sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

![Hamiltonian Cycle Graph](https://i.imgur.com/7VURwUi.png)

Find the Hamiltonian cycle in the above graph, starting and ending at vertex A.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once. In the given graph, we can find a Hamiltonian cycle starting and ending at vertex A as follows:

A → B → C → E → D → F → G → H → A

So, the Hamiltonian cycle is A-B-C-E-D-F-G-H-A.
